definition: Mei Lanfang (1894-1961), famous master of Beijing opera, specialist in female roles
old variant of 梅[mei2]
surname Mei
variant of 梅[mei2]
plum/plum flower/Japanese apricot (Prunus mume)
surname Lan/abbr. for Lanzhou 蘭州|兰州[Lan2 zhou1], Gansu
orchid (蘭花|兰花 Cymbidium goeringii)/fragrant thoroughwort (蘭草|兰草 Eupatorium fortunei)/lily magnolia (木蘭|木兰)
fragrant

sentences.english: Mei Lanfang is one of the greatest artor in China in 20th centry.
sentences.chinese: 梅兰芳是一个在第二十世纪在中国最大的阿托。

sentences.english: The best known of these was Mei Lanfang.
sentences.chinese: 当中最知名的就是梅兰芳。

sentences.english: Mei Lanfang is one of the four famous dans in Beijing opera.
sentences.chinese: 梅兰芳是京剧四大名旦之一。

sentences.english: The name of Mei Lanfang is popular among Chinese.
sentences.chinese: 梅兰芳这个名字在中国家喻户晓。

sentences.english: Among them, Mei Lanfang is acknowledged to be the symbol of China's performing art.
sentences.chinese: 其中，梅兰芳被公认为是中国表演艺术的代表。

sentences.english: Mei Lan Fang has been dead for many years but he remains a household name in China.
sentences.chinese: 梅兰芳早在许多年前就已过世，但他在中国家喻户晓。

sentences.english: Her teacher's teacher is Mei Lanfang.
sentences.chinese: 她师傅的师傅是梅兰芳。

sentences.english: A. Have you watched the movie "Forever Enthralled ", the latest work by director Chen Kaige?
sentences.chinese: 你看了陈凯歌导演的新作《梅兰芳》吗？

sentences.english: Mei Lanfang loved his country very much.
We wanted to make a Mei Lanfang in our own mind. Mr.
sentences.chinese: 我们要拍一个我们自己心目中的梅兰芳。
